item.source: How do u edit monster drops?

item.title: How do u edit monster drops?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

yea better make a little tut for him

ok to make npc drops go to item3.java (or any of the other item.java’s)

let use an i.e

public static int ICE[] = {####}; public static int randomICE() { return ICE[(int)(Math.random()*ICE.length)]; }

in the #### add the number of the item you want the npc to drop such as santa:

public static int ICE[] = {1050}; public static int randomICE() { return ICE[(int)(Math.random()*ICE.length)]; }

you can always add more by putting a , after the number

now save close open npc handler look for maybe:

//if(NPCID2 == 200) // this is index number in autospawn cfg, not actual npc id, if using more than 1 of the desired npc use more than one index - cheez //{ //ItemHandler.addItem(Item2.randomKBD(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); //}

after the } add:

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == ####) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomICE(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

same as the last one but put an npc id in their lets say kbd

if(npcs[NPCID].npcType == 50) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randomICE(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }

you can add more by useing a || i think hope this helped!

Read full topic
